channel.title: Ok BIG QUESTION
channel.description:
I have a source and a client folder/files
and im ready to bring my server online where do I put my servers IP at in the source or client folder?
and where at in those folders?
317 btw

item.title: Ok BIG QUESTION
item.dc:creator: @PolarScape PolarScape
item.description:
@PolarScape wrote:

[quote=“Never Again, post:5, topic:304554”]Well i messed up earlier and everywhere i found 127.0.0.1 I replaced it and ended up ip banning myself lol…

And how come people can connect with ip changing clients?

So apparently I need to put my IP into the source file somewhere…
Right?[/quote]

If you need to un-ip yourself go to your ipban log and remove your ip, and IP only needs to be with client not source files. Go to GUI.java search ip then you should find:

 serverip = "YOUR IP HERE"

change it to your ip , compile and save.

Read full topic

item.title: Ok BIG QUESTION
item.dc:creator: @Never_Again Never Again
item.description:
@Never_Again wrote:

Well i messed up earlier and everywhere i found 127.0.0.1 I replaced it and ended up ip banning myself lol…

And how come people can connect with ip changing clients?

So apparently I need to put my IP into the source file somewhere…
Right?

item.title: Ok BIG QUESTION

item.description:
@Never_Again wrote:

no-ip wasnt in the gui.java or the client.java

item.title: Ok BIG QUESTION
item.dc:creator: @resident123 resident123
item.description:
@resident123 wrote:

With Your ip you selected from no-ip.com

Go on the client and look in the folder . Client.Java
Search : .no-ip
Then Re-name it To Your Ip
If You cant find .no-ip in your client java.
Try Gui.java

Read full topic
